name: William Parker
description: '''William Parker''' (born January 10, 1952) is an American [[free jazz]] [[double bass]]ist. Beginning in the 1980s, Parker played with [[Cecil Taylor]] for over a decade, and he has led the Little Huey Creative Music Orchestra since 1981. ''[[The Village Voice]]'' named him "the most consistently brilliant free jazz bassist of all time" and ''[[DownBeat]]'' has called him "one of the most adventurous and prolific bandleaders in jazz".
